Row.Text: The Piazza is a unique Menagerie replacement only avaliable to Sardinia-Piedmont. This building increases the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism generated by the city, in addition to the [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness that it provides.
Our people are now drinking your wine and eating your gelato. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.

We, the people of Sardinia-Piedmont, have long known this truth: that the scattered peoples of Italy would one day be reunited, as was so during the far gone time of the Caesars. It is an honour and a privilege that this sacred destiny has been granted unto us, and with a joyful heart, we do declare the creation of a whole and one and new Italian state under God.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Sardinia-Piedmont [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have captured at least four City-States [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Renaissance Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Name changes to Italy [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Unlocks the 'Establish Royal Vineyard' Decision [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Claims all workable tiles in conquered City-States

We, the people of Sardinia-Piedmont, have long known this truth: that the scattered peoples of Italy would one day be reunited, as was so during the far gone time of the Caesars. It is an honour and a privilege that this sacred destiny has been granted unto us, and with a joyful heart, we do declare the creation of a whole and one and new Italian state under God.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Name changes to Italy [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Claims all workable tiles in conquered City-States
{1_LeaderName} has united the scattered peoples of the Italian nation into one state.

In all the world there is no greater source of fine wine than in Italy. Our ancestors knew this, and today we carry on this legacy. Yet, as her great leader, we do not have a vineyard of our own! Such an absurd deficiency is a grave and ignoble shame. Let us fix that, shall we? [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Sardinia-Piedmont/Italy (Victor Emmanuel II) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Renaissance Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have at least one [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Establishes the Royal Vineyard National Wonder in a city of your choice

In all the world there is no greater source of fine wine than in Italy. Our ancestors knew this, and today we carry on this legacy. Yet, as her great leader, we do not have a vineyard of our own! Such an absurd deficiency is a grave and ignoble shame. Let us fix that, shall we? [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Establishes the Royal Vineyard National Wonder in a city of your choice
{1_LeaderName} has established a Royal Vineyard at the {2_CivAdj} city of {3_CityName}.
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from each source of [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine (up to 5). Provides +2 [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine.

A vineyard is a plantation of grape-bearing vines, grown mainly for winemaking, but also raisins, table grapes and non-alcoholic grape juice. The science, practice and study of vineyard production is known as viticulture. A vineyard is often characterised by its terroir, a French term loosely translating as "a sense of place" that refers to the specific geographical and geological characteristics of grapevine plantations, which may be imparted in the wine.
Select a city where to establish your Royal Vineyard
This will establish {1_CityName} as your Royal Vineyard
A great new machine which can brew Coffee in an instant has been invented in {1_City}. Angelo Moriondo, the inventor, has called it most suitably the 'expresso.'

A linen cloth bearing the face of a crucified man claimed to be an important religious figure has been entrusted into our care. Scientists demand that we release the linen for scientific analysis, historians seek to catalogue it, and theologians wish for it to be given to the care of our religious leaders.[NEWLINE]
Let the scientists do their tests.
Let the historians catalogue this shroud.
This icon must be kept safe with our religious leaders.
We have allowed scientists to examine the Shroud of Turin, but they have reached no firm conclusion as to its authenticity.
We have allowed historians to catalogue the Shroud of Turin, but they have reached no firm conclusion as to its authenticity.
We have placed the Shroud of Turin into the care of our religious leaders.
Scientists in {1_CivName} have been unable to authenticate a shroud, known the Shroud of Turin, bearing the face of a religious figure.
Historians have begun to write on a shroud, known the Shroud of Turin, bearing the face of a religious figure in {1_CivName}.
A shroud, known the Shroud of Turin, bearing the face of a religious figure has been entrusted into the care of {1_LeaderName}.

A nationalist fervour has griped the city of {1_CityName} after a showing of Verdi's Va, pensiero. The people have spoken, and they have risen up in arms against those who would prevent their homeland from being whole.[NEWLINE]
Our Italy must be made whole!
A nationalist fervour has griped the city of {1_CityName} after a showing of Verdi's Va, pensiero.
A nationalist fervour has griped the {1_CivAdj} city of {2_CityName} after a showing of Verdi's Va, pensiero.
